Louisville-Ohio State basketball live blog

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 11:16 p.m. EST December 2, 2014
Buy Photo

A first half Montrezl Harrell dunk forced an Ohio State timeout Tuesday at the KFC Yum! Center.(Photo: By Scott Utterback/The Courier-Journal)Buy Photo

8 CONNECT 12 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) for updates during the University of Louisville's 9:35 p.m. Tuesday basketball game against Ohio State at the KFC Yum! Center.

7:36, 2H: Ohio State isn't going away. The Buckeyes, now down 45-36, will have free throws out of the under-eight timeout.

Chris Jones and Terry Rozier so far tonight: 2-19 from the field, 2-12 from 3, seven assists, seven turnovers. In fairness, also 11 rebs.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 3, 2014

8:22, 2H: Wayne Blackshear just drove to the basket and made an acrobatic shuffle move on the layup, drawing a foul. Speaking of those, Marc Loving and D'Angelo Russell have four apiece.

9:48, 2H: The U of L lead is down to 11 now after a missed Wayne Blackshear jumper and quick transition to D'Angelo Russell's layup. Neither team is clicking offensively with the Cards 2 of 10 in the second half.

10:16, 2H: Anas Mahmoud blocked an Ohio State shot out of bounds, and Montrezl Harrell nearly followed with one of his own. Instead, officials called a foul. After a Marc Loving free throw, the score is 42-39. This half, the Buckeyes are 3 of 14 from the field.

11:23, 2H: Montrezl Harrell is nearing a double-double at the under-12 timeout, with 9 points and 7 rebounds, as the Cards lead 42-27.

But when does Aaron Craft come in for Ohio State?

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 3, 2014

12:28, 2H: Terry Rozier, with his hand wrapped, is already back on the court.

13:47, 2H: Ohio State's run leveled off. That's not that U of L answered back, but the Buckeyes, after scoring 6 points in 59 seconds, have missed their next five shots. It's 39-24 after a pair of Chris Jones free throws.

15:19, 2H: Terry Rozier just headed straight to the locker room with a hand injury as U of L's lead remains 37-24 at the under-16 timeout. Before play started back up, he'd returned to the huddle.

Terry Rozier's having a tough night so far. He's 0 for 6 from the field with four turnovers. Walking off now holding his left pinky.

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 3, 2014

16:43, 2H: Ohio State's full court press has helped the Buckeyes show some life. They cut it to 37-24 on an Amir Williams dunk, and Rick Pitino immediately called for his second timeout of the evening. It's a 6-0 run over 59 seconds for the visitors.

17:42, 2H: Chinanu Onuaku just picked up his third foul and is headed to the bench in favor of Anas Mahmoud. Mahmoud may be getting the edge with Mangok Mathiang nursing a sore ankle. U of L leads 37-19.

18:54, 2H: U of L picked up where it left off, with Terry Rozier lobbing an alley-oop dunk to Montrezl Harrell. Timeout Ohio State.

Wayne Blackshear has 16 points at halftime for Louisville His opponent, Ohio State, has 18 total points

— ESPN Stats & Info (@ESPNStatsInfo) December 3, 2014

20:00, 2H: Starters are out to open the second half for both sides. Lost a bit in the halftime box score were five Terry Rozier assists. Also, four Cardinals -- including Anas Mahmoud off the bench -- hauled in 5 rebounds.

Halftime: U of L 35, Ohio State 18.

Wayne Blackshear poured in a game-high 16 points to go with 5 rebounds. Chris Jones and Montrezl Harrell had 6 points apiece, too, as the Buckeyes went 23.1 percent from the field.

See a full box score: http://bit.ly/1rWyy20

The number of halves both UofL and UK are holding teams under 20 is insane

— Steve Jones (@SteveJones_CJ) December 3, 2014

1:12, 1H: A D'Angelo Russell basket and foul -- he appeared to release the ball with his back to the basket -- is Ohio State's highlight of this one so far. But the Buckeyes can't keep pace with U of L and Wayne Blackshear, whose back to back 3-pointers have pushed the Cards out to a 35-16 lead near the end of the half. Blackshear has 16 points on the night.

I have a hard time believing either Louisville or Kentucky gets north of 60 in a few weeks.

— Mark Ennis (@MarkEnnis) December 3, 2014

2:58, 1H: A Sam Thompson 3-pointer broke a nearly five-minute Ohio State scoring drought before the under-four timeout. U of L leads 29-13 and has forced nine turnovers while dominating the paint with a 12-2 edge.

5:13, 1H: U of L's getting it done at both ends, most recently on a Wayne Blackshear steal and putback off a Chris Jones fast break layup, which the Cards followed with a pair of Terry Rozier. The lead has swelled to 29-10.

6:39, 1H: A Montrezl Harrell dunk out of the media timeout has U of L ahead 25-10 now, the Cardinals' largest lead. Ohio State has three turnovers in the last 1:26.

.@accmbb Hey guys... we got this.

— Louie the Cardinal (@LouietheCard) December 3, 2014

7:32, 1H: U of L has upped its lead, now ahead 23-10, with Anas Mahmoud on the floor playing his most meaningful minutes of the season. Already, five Cardinals have scored -- as many who had points in the entire Cleveland State game -- led by 8 from Wayne Blackshear.

9:47, 1H: Down double digits on the road isn't the time to send your best player to the bench. Thad Matta had little choice. D'Angelo Russell just picked up his second foul. The Buckeyes are off to a 2 for 16 start.

10:40, 1H: The U of L lead is 10 now -- 18-8 -- on a Quentin Snider 3-pointer. Five Cardinals players have already scored.

Lorenzo Mauldin, with his teammates at center court, "As long as we, as a team, stick together, UK will never beat us."

— Jeff Greer (@jeffgreer_cj) December 3, 2014

11:08, 1H: Between Ohio State's timeout and the under-12 break, the Buckeyes' Kam Williams hit a 3-pointer to pull the visitors to within 15-8. Ohio State continues to struggle on offense, now 2 of 13 from the field.

12:00, 1H: The Cards are on an 8-0 run and lead 13-5, but there's more foul trouble. Out is Mangok Mathiang, like Chinanu Onuaku with two fouls. Freshman Anas Mahmoud is on the floor at center now. Timeout Ohio State as Montrezl Harrell fills the stat sheet: 4 points, 3 offensive rebounds, a pair of assists and a steal early.

Top 10 atmosphere.

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 3, 2014

13:30, 1H: Off the bench early is backup point guard Quentin Snider, now on the floor with D'Angelo Russell, his former AAU teammate.

15:27, 1H: On a Sam Thompson drive into Chinanu Onuaku, the Cards' big man picked up a foul the fans here didn't like so much. Thompson hit both his free throws, pulling the Buckeyes to within 5-4. And with his second foul, Onuaku is off to the bench.

15:31, 1H: The Cards' defense starred in this game's first segment. Ohio State opened 1 of 8 from the field and rarely ventured into the paint, missing all 4 of its 3-pointers as well. U of L leads 5-2 with a pair of steals and a block defensively as well.

Well that's an introduction. #L1C4pic.twitter.com/zoOaFS8j0R

— Scott Utterback (@Utterback13) December 3, 2014

16:55, 1H: Montrezl Harrell is off to an 0 for 2 free throw shooting start. The Cards lead 5-2 anyway on a highlight reel dunk by Wayne Blackshear on an assist from Harrell.

17:58, 1H Rick Pitino wanted U of L to back off on its 3-point shooting, but the Cardinals aren't listening early. After two misses from beyond the arc, though, Chinanu Onuaku got U of L off to an early 2-0 lead, equaled by Louisville native D'Angelo Russell on the other end.

Referees tonight are Karl Hess, Mike Stephens and Brian Dorsey. In other words, settle in...

Denny addition to intro: "Wow Rick your non-conference schedule looks really tough" Rick: "Like old times"

— Mark Blankenbaker (@UofLSheriff50) December 3, 2014

Then of course: "Let's Do This"

— Mark Blankenbaker (@UofLSheriff50) December 3, 2014

20:00, 1H: No surprises in tonight's starting lineups, and this one will start on time with Michigan holding on to beat Syracuse 68-65 for a strong lead-in on ESPN.

As for the best game atmosphere in Yum! Center history? It's a bit slow arriving, somehow, for a late, late tip.

By the way, in his "last call" bet of the night, CBS Sports' Gary Parrish picked U of L to win the game by Ohio State to cover on a 9-point spread.

"Thad Matta +9 means the only way we lose is if Ohio State loses by double-digits, and Ohio State under Thad Matta rarely loses by double-digits," Parrish noted. "How rarely does it happen? Only twice a season, on average, the past five seasons."

.@Lozo_Mauldin_IV and teammates are in the house at Louisville vs Ohio State. #L1C4pic.twitter.com/QZaPI2pZTG

— Scott Utterback (@Utterback13) December 3, 2014

PREGAME: Nap time's over.

We're counting down to what may end up the latest tipoff of the season for No. 5 U of L, which hosts No. 14 Ohio State in the Cardinals' first ACC/Big Ten Challenge game.

With plenty of eyes nationally on this one, look for the latest from national types getting their first looks at U of L as well as tweets from our own team here at the Yum! Center. Any big plays, too, and we'll hunt down a Vine or Instagram video.

By my count, there are 26 NBA scouts with seats here at Yum Center for Ohio State/Louisville.

— Adam Himmelsbach (@AdamHimmelsbach) December 3, 2014

Stick around afterward for a final box score and live video of coach Rick Pitino's postgame comments.

For more pregame reading, check out a game preview (http://cjky.it/1rWykYv), column (http://cjky.it/1rSwvSc), feature on D'Angelo Russell's return to Louisville (http://cjky.it/1Bbos5C) and other story lines (http://cjky.it/1rWyizU).

U of L's fan support excites Terrance Ferguson, who's visiting Cards today http://t.co/Td2OwCoRZS

— Steve Jones (@SteveJones_CJ) December 3, 2014

Probable U of L Starters

G Chris Jones

G Terry Rozier

F Wayne Blackshear

F Montrezl Harrell

C Chinanu Onuaku

Probable Ohio State Starters

G Shannon Scott

G D'Angelo Russell

F Marc Loving

F Sam Thompson

F Amir Williams
